In Israeli prisons, hunger and torture are ever-present
subhead: Le Monde has collected the accounts of three civilians from the West Bank who were detained for months without trial or judgment and subjected to food deprivation and regular beatings. Two years after the beginning of the war against Gaza, more than 11,000 Palestinians remain incarcerated in Israel.

In Portland, activists use humor to counter Donald Trump's apocalyptic portrayal of the city
subhead: Highlighting violence and 'anarchy' tied to the 'radical left,' the American president has promised to send the National Guard to the Oregon city, long known for its activism. Both local authorities and demonstrators protesting aggressive migrant expulsions have rejected this depiction.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Sylvie Laurent, historian: 'McCarthyism was a minor version of what is unfolding in the United States today'
subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, the American studies scholar voices concern over the climate of suspicion and repression that, in the name of fighting the 'enemy within,' is taking root for the long term in Donald Trump's America.

title: With 'The Lost Bus,' the disaster film genre rises from California's ashes
subhead: Inspired by the 2018 Camp Fire in California, Paul Greengrass's feature film also marks Matthew McConaughey's return to the screen.

title: From Bob Dylan to Taylor Swift, the resurrection of the Ophelia myth
subhead: More and more female singers are reinterpreting the Shakespearean figure, drawing on her imagery but rejecting the tragic outcome of her fate.

subhead: Elected on May 8, the American-Peruvian pontiff has yet to clarify his vision for the Catholic Church. Some recent statements have indicated that Leo XIV may continue along the lines of Francis on several key issues.

title: Matthieu Blazy: 'Just because Karl was a legend does not mean that everyone who designs for Chanel has to be one too'
subhead: The anticipation was overwhelming. But on Monday, the first show by Chanel's new artistic director under the glass roof of the Grand Palais lived up to all expectations. With his impeccable CV and strong personality, the 41-year-old designer has written the first page of a new chapter for the fashion house. His mission? To usher it into a new era without losing its soul.

title: Two years after October 7, many French Jews have chosen silence: 'We're made to feel that we're on the wrong side'
subhead: Since the Hamas terrorist attack in Israel, faced with an 'outside world' perceived as hostile or incapable of understanding them, many Jews have chosen to avoid discussing current events and say they are tempted to withdraw from society.
byline: By Louise Couvelaire and Benoît Vitkine
